Abstract: This autobiographical account chronicles the career of a clinical psychologist specializing in alcohol research. The narrative traces the author's journey from doctoral training to becoming a prominent figure in the field of alcohol use disorders. Key milestones include mentoring experiences, contributions to journal editing, and active involvement in professional societies. The author reflects on the evolution of alcohol research over several decades, highlighting significant advancements in understanding the etiology, assessment, and treatment of alcohol-related problems. Personal insights are shared regarding the challenges and rewards of pursuing a career dedicated to alcohol studies, including the impact of changing societal attitudes towards alcohol use. The account also explores the author's role in shaping alcohol policies and fostering interdisciplinary collaborations. This retrospective offers valuable perspectives on the development of alcohol research as a distinct field within clinical psychology and addiction science.
